intro: Chuquiraga anomala, commonly known as the Andean buttercup, is a flowering plant native to the Andes region of South America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in high-altitude environments, often in rocky or alpine soils, and is well adapted to cold climates. Its yellow-orange flowers bloom in spring and are surrounded by a series of small, petal-like structures called phyllaries. Chuquiraga anomala is also valued for its ornamental appeal and has been used in traditional medicine by local communities.
